highlights.para: This chapter explains how to prepare files needed to run the simulator, and how to run the simulation with &app;.

sect1.title: Preparing Simulation
sect1.para:
To start the simulation, you need at least these types of files:
A model file in EML format
(optionally but usually) shared object files (.so in Linux operating system), if you are using special classes of object in the model file which is not provided by the system by default.
If you have them in different formats other than EML and .so, you have to convert your files (such as EM and DM) by procedures explained in this section.

note.para: When debugging the DM files users may want to check converted C++ source code (.cpp files). Use -g commandline option to command emtool program to stop after generating and before compiling and deleting the source code.

Sometimes advanced users may want to create SO files directly from C++ source code files (.cpp files). Use -c commandline option to let emtool program interpret the input as C++ source code, not DM scipt.
